name: Idaho Falls River Walk
description: Beautiful walking path along the Snake River with views of the Idaho Falls Temple and the famous waterfall.

name: Idaho Falls Temple
description: Historic LDS temple with beautiful gardens overlooking the Snake River.

name: Museum of Idaho
address: 200 N Eastern Ave, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Interactive museum featuring exhibits on Idaho history and rotating international collections.

name: Snake River Landing
address: Snake River Pkwy, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Modern shopping and entertainment district with restaurants, offices, and event spaces.

name: Melaleuca Field
description: Baseball stadium home to the Idaho Falls Chukars minor league baseball team.

name: Tautphaus Park
description: Large park with Idaho Falls Zoo, rides, tennis courts, baseball fields, and picnic areas.

name: Idaho Falls Zoo at Tautphaus Park
description: Small but well-maintained zoo with over 300 animals from around the world.

name: The Snakebite Restaurant
description: Popular restaurant and bar serving craft beers and creative American cuisine.

name: Grand Teton Mall
description: Shopping mall with department stores, specialty retailers, and a food court.

name: ARTitorium on Broadway
address: 271 W Broadway St, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Interactive art center for kids with hands-on exhibits and creative programs.

name: Freeman Park
address: Science Center Dr, Idaho Falls, ID 83401
description: Riverside park with sports fields, disc golf course, and paved walking paths.

name: Jakers Bar and Grill
description: Popular steakhouse and American restaurant with a great atmosphere.

name: Japanese Friendship Garden
description: Serene Japanese garden along the river walk with beautiful landscaping and bridges.

name: Art Museum of Eastern Idaho
address: 300 S Capital Ave, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Contemporary art museum featuring exhibitions by regional and national artists.

name: Russ Freeman Bandshell
description: Historic bandshell in the heart of Idaho Falls, hosting summer concerts and events.

name: Idaho Brewing Company
address: 775 S Capital Ave, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Local craft brewery offering tours and tastings of their award-winning beers.

name: The Paramount
description: Historic theater featuring classic architecture and showing independent films.

name: Sportsman's Warehouse
description: Large outdoor retailer selling hunting, fishing, and camping gear.

name: Villa Coffeehouse
description: Cozy cafe serving specialty coffee, pastries, and light lunch options.

name: Taylor's Crossing Bridge
address: N River Rd, Idaho Falls, ID 83401
description: Historic railroad bridge converted to a pedestrian walkway across the Snake River.

name: Idaho Falls Farmer's Market
address: Memorial Dr & Park Ave, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Seasonal outdoor market offering local produce, crafts, and food vendors.

name: Hell's Half Acre
description: Unique lava field just outside Idaho Falls with interpretive trails and viewing areas.

name: Snowball's Chance Saloon
description: Local bar with a laid-back atmosphere, pool tables, and cold beer.

name: Idaho Falls Public Library
address: 457 W Broadway St, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Modern public library with a large collection, community programs, and river views.

name: Collectors Corner Museum
address: 900 Pier View Dr, Idaho Falls, ID 83402
description: Unique museum displaying eclectic collections of toys, memorabilia, and Americana.
